intro: Tarenna calycina, commonly known as the velvetleaf tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a velvety texture. Tarenna calycina is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
